definition: lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: He takes his parents' advice as a breeze passing by.
sentences.chinese: 他將父母親的話當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Don't throw my warnings to the wind.
sentences.chinese: 別把我的勸告當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Dares ours speech to work as neglected advice?
sentences.chinese: 敢把我們的話當耳邊風？

sentences.english: He took my words like a passing wind.
The thing that really annoys me is that he did not take my words seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他把我的話當耳邊風，這實在令我生氣。

sentences.english: What you did to make your brother tune you out.
sentences.chinese: 你究竟做了什麼才使得你弟弟把你的話當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Mary: I take it that you chose to ignore your dentist's warning.
sentences.chinese: 我明白了，你把對牙醫的告誡當耳邊風。

sentences.english: Anything we told him went in at one ear and out at the other.
sentences.chinese: 不管我們對他說什麼，他總是當耳邊風。
